headline: Dow Jones Futures: Nasdaq Tumbles But These Sectors Lead; AMD, Lumentum Are Earnings Movers Late
summary: Techs and chips struggled Tuesday, while consumer staples, regional banks, precious metals and industrials are areas of strength. AMD, Lumentum were earnings movers late.

headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing Walmart’s Story And Fair Value Outlook?
summary: The latest update nudges Walmart's fair value estimate slightly higher, from US$123.20 to US$124.28 per share. This change is supported by a modest refinement in the model that keeps revenue growth and the discount rate almost unchanged. It reflects a research backdrop where many analysts are still constructive, pointing to solid execution, share gains and growth in higher quality revenue streams, while a more cautious group highlights risks around retail trends and guidance. If you want to...

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Code Red
summary: Anthropic's launch of new AI productivity tools spooked investors. The worries hit a wide swath of software and data service companies. Among the worst-hit companies on the Nasdaq were Thomson Reuters and Intuit, which shed 16% and 11%, respectively.

content.title: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Code Red
content.summary: Anthropic's launch of new AI productivity tools spooked investors. The worries hit a wide swath of software and data service companies. Among the worst-hit companies on the Nasdaq were Thomson Reuters and Intuit, which shed 16% and 11%, respectively.

headline: Dow Jones Futures Rise Amid Market Shift Out Of Tech; AMD, Lumentum Are Earnings Movers
summary: The Nasdaq fell below its 50-day line while consumer staples, regional banks, precious metals and industrials showed strength. AMD, Lumentum were earnings movers overnight.

content.title: Dow Jones Futures Rise Amid Market Shift Out Of Tech; AMD, Lumentum Are Earnings Movers
content.summary: The Nasdaq fell below its 50-day line while consumer staples, regional banks, precious metals and industrials showed strength. AMD, Lumentum were earnings movers overnight.

headline: Stock Futures Drop as Tech Selloff Rages On Before Alphabet Earnings
summary: Stocks looked set to continue falling Wednesday, while the price of gold carried on rallying as investors bought the dip following a brutal selloff in precious metals.  S&P 500 futures slid 0.1%, and contracts tied to the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 dropped 0.3%.  The S&P and Nasdaq looked set to extend their selloffs from the previous session, when both gauges tumbled after Anthropic’s new artificial-intelligence automation tool sparked a brutal selloff in software stocks.

headline: Morning Bid: AI scatters the tech herd
summary: and global markets today , Editor-At-Large, Finance and Markets The AI wave clearly doesn't float all boats. Tuesday's withering shakeout in the shares of software, data analytics and professional services operations shows how new AI development can cut both ways.

headline: Amazon's physical grocery push deepens its fight against rival Walmart
summary: Amazon was once the upstart running ahead of Walmart with its revolutionary e-commerce business.  Analysts ​expect Amazon's fourth-quarter physical store revenue, which includes Whole Foods, Amazon Fresh and Amazon Go sales, to increase 5.4% ‌from a year ago to $5.9 billion when it reports results on Thursday, according to estimates from LSEG.  The company's retail ‌operations are still a key part of the business, even as it sees fast growth from its technology division, Amazon Web Services, which accounts for 18% of its revenue.

content.title: Amazon's physical grocery push deepens its fight against rival Walmart
content.summary: Amazon was once the upstart running ahead of Walmart with its revolutionary e-commerce business.  Analysts ​expect Amazon's fourth-quarter physical store revenue, which includes Whole Foods, Amazon Fresh and Amazon Go sales, to increase 5.4% ‌from a year ago to $5.9 billion when it reports results on Thursday, according to estimates from LSEG.  The company's retail ‌operations are still a key part of the business, even as it sees fast growth from its technology division, Amazon Web Services, which accounts for 18% of its revenue.

headline: MAMMOTION Expands U.S. Retail Presence, Bringing Wire-Free Robotic Lawn Mowers to Retail Stores Nationwide
summary: MAMMOTION, a global leader in wire-free robotic lawn care technology, today announced a major expansion of its U.S. retail footprint that will see its award-winning robotic lawn mowers on sale in Walmart, Home Depot and Lowe's stores nationwide. Beginning immediately at Walmart, followed by rollouts in Home Depot and Lowe's within the first few months of 2026, the expansion marks a major milestone in the mainstream adoption of robotic mowing.

content.title: MAMMOTION Expands U.S. Retail Presence, Bringing Wire-Free Robotic Lawn Mowers to Retail Stores Nationwide
content.summary: MAMMOTION, a global leader in wire-free robotic lawn care technology, today announced a major expansion of its U.S. retail footprint that will see its award-winning robotic lawn mowers on sale in Walmart, Home Depot and Lowe's stores nationwide. headline: Stock Futures See-Saw in Volatile Trading After Brutal Tech Selloff. Gold Rallies.
summary: Stocks looked set to struggle for direction on Wednesday, while the price of gold continued to rally as investors bought the dip following a brutal selloff in precious metals.  Contracts tied to the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 were broadly flat.  The three major indexes all tumbled the previous session, after Anthropic’s new artificial-intelligence automation tool sparked a brutal selloff in software stocks.

content.title: Stock Futures See-Saw in Volatile Trading After Brutal Tech Selloff. Gold Rallies.

Contracts tied to the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 were broadly flat.  The three major indexes all tumbled the previous session, after Anthropic’s new artificial-intelligence automation tool sparked a brutal selloff in software stocks.

headline: Shoptalk Announces Initial Speakers for 2026 Spring Event in Las Vegas
summary: NEW YORK, February 04, 2026--Shoptalk, the leading global event for retail innovation, today announced the initial speaker lineup for its 2026 spring conference taking place March 24–26 at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. Featuring more than 50 sessions, the conference will bring together more than 10,000 attendees, with one in three holding a C-suite role at a retailer, consumer brand or tech company.

content.title: Shoptalk Announces Initial Speakers for 2026 Spring Event in Las Vegas
content.summary: NEW YORK, February 04, 2026--Shoptalk, the leading global event for retail innovation, today announced the initial speaker lineup for its 2026 spring conference taking place March 24–26 at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. Featuring more than 50 sessions, the conference will bring together more than 10,000 attendees, with one in three holding a C-suite role at a retailer, consumer brand or tech company.

headline: WMT Joins the $1 Trillion Club: Can the Rally Continue for the Stock?
summary: After hitting a $1 trillion market cap, WMT's rally reflects confidence in omnichannel growth, higher-margin ads and memberships, and global digital momentum.

content.title: WMT Joins the $1 Trillion Club: Can the Rally Continue for the Stock?
content.summary: After hitting a $1 trillion market cap, WMT's rally reflects confidence in omnichannel growth, higher-margin ads and memberships, and global digital momentum.
